Itâ€™s similar to capital guaranteed insurance plans/funds. They do invest in risky assets like equities and credit, but they do so because the duration of their liabilities matches these risks. When a stablecoin issuer (e.g., Circle) is 10x larger than the current market and has a high on-chain transaction turnover, withdrawal events would tend to be small. In this scenario, the issuer may take on riskier assets. Itâ€™s all about actuarial models and asset-liability matching.
But also the entire money market fund liquidity ecosystem has become treasury dominant since 2008 which is a whole downstream problem TBD
Blockchain doesnâ€™t ask for permission; it forces us to imagine a new world...
They would take more duration if it were more clearly legal
Theyâ€™ll start taking on duration & credit risk and then we better hope the first one to fuck it up is small

If interest rates do fall and USDC revenue falls (because they're not allowed to take longer dated treasuries which would go up in value) - it will be interesting to study the reactions in DeFi activity.
Tbh thatâ€™s why I donâ€™t get the ire against CBDCs - private stables just do the same thing but inject another layer of PII / AML / KYC / credit and *increasingly* duration risk

In truly defi only overcollateralisations then the safety aspect holds but in reality almost everything now is pegged by either: tether, circle or Ethena but as safe as these are, none have lenders of last resort. The first two are money market funds, the latter is a hedgefund.

Credit risk mgmt will always be the gamma-shock for almost any market.

The defi edge is distribution and efficiency. The transparency side is a double edged sword and less practically useful where RWAs are concerned since risks reside mainly offchain

RWAs inject exactly the same risk tbhâ€¦ weâ€™re always one bad credit default away from a chain reaction like genesis. Thereâ€™s no reason defi startups are better at managing credit than tradfi; in fact theyâ€™re objectively worse from the credit ratings that have been given out. Thereâ€™s reality is defi is increasingly becoming where tradfi dumps what it dumped in CDOs
